The results are shown for different workload matrix sizes (n), with α = 1 (no weight decay) and β = 0 (no momentum).  The error is calculated using the Frobenius norm of the error matrix, which measures the overall approximation error of the factorization.  The table specifically shows how the errors change as the matrix size is increased. The 'sqrt' column shows the results using a plain square root decomposition which is a common baseline.
